Sentencas: The stability of Nd-nickelate, considered as an alternative solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) cathode material, was evaluated in this work on its tolerance towards contaminants.
Titulo: Nd-nickelate solid oxide fuel cell cathode sensitivity to Cr and Si contamination

Sentencas: Symmetrical cells with Nd1.95NiO4+delta (NNO) electrodes sintered on gadolinia-doped ceria electrolyte supports were monitored over time-spans of 1000 h at 700 degrees C under polarization in an air-flux with deliberate chromium contamination.
Titulo: Nd-nickelate solid oxide fuel cell cathode sensitivity to Cr and Si contamination

Sentencas: Impedance spectroscopy pointed out a polarization increase with time by the growth of the low frequency arc describing the electrode's oxygen reduction and incorporation processes.
Titulo: Nd-nickelate solid oxide fuel cell cathode sensitivity to Cr and Si contamination

Sentencas: Post-test observations revealed polluted cathode regions with increasing amounts of Cr accumulations towards the electrolyte/cathode interface.
Titulo: Nd-nickelate solid oxide fuel cell cathode sensitivity to Cr and Si contamination

Sentencas: Cr deposits were evidenced to surround active nickelate grain surfaces forming Nd-containing Cr oxides.
Titulo: Nd-nickelate solid oxide fuel cell cathode sensitivity to Cr and Si contamination

Sentencas: In addition to exogenous Cr contamination, endogenous contamination was revealed.
Titulo: Nd-nickelate solid oxide fuel cell cathode sensitivity to Cr and Si contamination

Sentencas: Silicon, present as impurity material in the raw NNO powder (introduced by milling during powder processing), reacts during sintering steps to form Nd-silicate phases, which decreases the active cathode surface.
Titulo: Nd-nickelate solid oxide fuel cell cathode sensitivity to Cr and Si contamination

Sentencas: Nd-depletion of the nickelate, as a result of secondary phase formation with the contaminants Cr and Si (NdCrO4 and Nd4Si3O12), then triggers the thermally-induced decomposition of NNO into stoichio-metric Nd2NiO4+delta and NiO. Summarized, the alternative Nd-nickelate cathode also suffers from degradation caused by pollutant species, like standard perovskites.
Titulo: Nd-nickelate solid oxide fuel cell cathode sensitivity to Cr and Si contamination
